page.title: 10Tavistock Parish Church
page.content:
Our church is called St.Eustachius and is about 600 years old.It was built of Hurdwick stone by the monks of{Tavistock Abbey}and two of the big doors in the tower used to be the cartway into the Abbey. The font is very special because{Francis Drake}was christened in it. Before the days of organs, hymns were played by a band up in a gallery and one of the instruments, called a {serpent,}is hanging on the tower wall. On the end of one of the pews is a tiny white mouse which is the signature of the craftsman who carved the pews.
People worship every day in our church and probably have done since the very beginning except during the {Civil War}when Cromwell's soldiers lived in it and vandalised it.
